content: to last 2 stitches kfb k1 1 67 c13 rs k1 yo k to last 2 sts k2tog c14 ws sl1wyif p to last 2 sts kfb k1 repeat row c13 and c14 two more times c15 c16 c17 c18 3 70 garter section as described above 6 row = 3 garter ridges 3 73 eyelet section as described above 10 row 5 78 garter section as described above 6 row = 3 garter ridges 3 81 chain stitch section as described above 18 row 9 90 garter section as described above 6 row - 3 garter ridges 3 93 eyelet section as described above 10 row 5 98 garter stitch border g1 rs k1 yo k to last 2sts k2tog 4 102 g2 ws sl1wyif k to last 2sts kfb k1 repeat g1 and g2 three more times to create4 garter ridges or keep knitting in garter stitch to desired border width bobble using a stretchy bind off may i borrow this please page 3 abbreviations and notes k- knit k2tog- knit 2 stitches together kfb knit into the front and back of the stitch p- purl rs right side of work sl slip_stitch purlwise sl1wyib- slip 1 stitch purlwise with yarn held at the back of the work sl1wyif- slip 1 stitch purlwise with yarn held in front of the work ws- wrong side of work yo yarn over row in each section are designated with a letter describing the section g1 is garter section row 1 c3 is chain stitch section row 3 e1 is eyelet section row1 etc a note on the name… this pattern was named by and for my friend kathy who frequently likes to walk away with other people s knitting when she likes it it is a high compliment when she walks off with one s work she always returns it  please send any comments or corrections to lpwaitman on ravelry com may i borrow this please page 4
